IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.synopsis: A player sorcerer has this dialog as a special reaction to the first encounter with the sussur flower's aura that drains magic. This is about roleplay and your party - this might be the first time the player has ever been without magic. Companions can be supportive/insulting/etc.
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer.how_to_trigger: Approach any sussur flower. This dialogue triggers 0.5 seconds after entering the aura.

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_97.speaker: Narrator
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_97.text: *A chill runs through you. Your magic - the fire that burns within is... fading.*
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_97.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player looks at their hands in surprise

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_62.speaker: Player
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_62.text: Try to cast a simple cantrip.

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_86.speaker: Narrator
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_86.text: *The magic in your fingers sparks but your spells fail again and again - consumed by the sussur flower.*
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_86.context: CinematicNodeContext: Holds out a hand, flicks it as if trying to cast a spell, which fails. Tries one more time. Player looks curious at hand, but not too concerned.

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_6.speaker: Player
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_6.text: Close your eyes. Breathe into the feeling.

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_25.speaker: Narrator
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_25.text: *Your magic gently and effortlessly flows from you - and into the sussur flower.*
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_25.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player closes eyes at beginning of line, head tilted back, as if enjoying the sensation

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_16.speaker: Lae'zel
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_16.text: Your pace has slowed. Are you unwell?

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_26.speaker: Player
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_26.text: It's the flower - my magic is gone.

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_34.speaker: Lae'zel
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_34.text: Then I shall make up for your shortcomings. As I have all along.
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_34.context: NodeContext: Not as snippy as usual. Subtly joking.

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_10.speaker: Lae'zel
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_10.text: Finely spotted. I've developed a taste for this pastime you call 'humour'.
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_10.context: NodeContext: Very pleased with herself that player realised she was joking

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_17.speaker: Lae'zel
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_17.text: Now come, and be heedful. The shadows are watching.

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_31.speaker: Lae'zel
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_31.text: Have you known me to joke?

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_13.speaker: Player
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_13.text: You are as modest as you are warm, Lae'zel.

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_57.speaker: Player
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_57.text: Please. I'm every bit the combatant you claim to be.

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_44.speaker: Lae'zel
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_44.text: Well done. You're beginning to trust your convictions.

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_15.speaker: Lae'zel
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_15.text: Your confidence grows. I'd almost think you believed your own words.

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_60.speaker: Lae'zel
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_60.text: Hardly. But go on, live your fantasy. I am not about to stop you.

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_48.speaker: Shadowheart
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_48.text: Chin up - I'll wager they'll come back as soon as we move away from here.

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_109.speaker: Player
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_109.text: I'm not worried. My powers will return if they're meant to.

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_46.speaker: Shadowheart
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_46.text: That's the spirit. Now let's get moving, before anything else goes missing.

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_89.speaker: Shadowheart
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_89.text: Of course I am. You're not going to be undone by a flower, are you?
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_89.context: NodeContext: Playful; verbally poking fun at the player.

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_54.speaker: Player
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_54.text: This is serious. I feel terrible. Empty.

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_43.speaker: Shadowheart
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_43.text: No harm in a brief dose of perspective. It'll pass, I'm sure.
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_43.context: NodeContext: Putting a positive spin on things.

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_29.speaker: Shadowheart
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_29.text: Perhaps this will cure you of some self-delusion then. Come on.

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_23.speaker: Shadowheart
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_23.text: So what do you have left to contribute? Your personality? Let's just hope those powers return soon.

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_88.speaker: Shadowheart
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_88.text: You've no flair for insults. Let's go, before I'm tempted to give you a lesson.

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_59.speaker: Player
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_59.text: They'll return if they're meant to - like a pet cat. Or maybe a feral one.

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_7.speaker: Shadowheart
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_7.text: Or perhaps they found a better life with a new owner. Time will tell.

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_108.speaker: Karlach
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_108.text: Gone gone? But... you're a sorcerer. Isn't magic... you?

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_90.speaker: Player
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_90.text: A temporary setback - I'm sure my powers will be back soon.

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_19.speaker: Karlach
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_19.text: It's the bloody Underdark. Never know what mad shit you're gonna run into down here.

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_3.speaker: Player
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_3.text: Yes - I need my powers back now.

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_111.speaker: Karlach
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_111.text: Until then, let me lead the way. Anything pops out from under a mushroom, and I'll make sure it doesn't grab my poor powerless pal.

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_0.speaker: Player
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_0.text: I'm more than my magic. Right?

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_83.speaker: Karlach
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_83.text: If you say so, soldier. Might want to start learning to swing a sword. Stay behind me until then - I'll crack anyone who messes with you.

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_22.speaker: Astarion
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_22.text: Might I suggest getting it back? We can't have anything happen to our favourite sorcerer now, can we?

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_42.speaker: Player
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_42.text: Yes, I'll just 'get it back' - what a helpful suggestion, thank you!

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_40.speaker: Astarion
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_40.text: Oh don't be such a pill, darling. We're just having a little fun.
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_40.context: NodeContext: Someone you like isn't joking along with you

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_8.speaker: Player
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_8.text: Magic's a part of me - it'll come back when it's ready.

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_92.speaker: Astarion
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_92.text: All right, if you say so.

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_107.speaker: Astarion
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_107.text: Might I suggest getting it back? I don't travel with you for your personality, you know.

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_99.speaker: Player
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_99.text: That's not funny. It feels like I've lost a limb.

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_110.speaker: Astarion
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_110.text: Let's finish up here and then get away from that damned plant. Until then, we'll keep you safe.

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_100.speaker: Astarion
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_100.text: It took your power and your sense of humour? How wretched.

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_24.speaker: Player
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_24.text: The feeling is very mutual, my friend.

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_65.speaker: Astarion
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_65.text: Your sense of humour is still intact, at least.

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_78.speaker: Astarion
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_78.text: Let's finish up here quickly - the sooner we can get your magic back, the safer we'll be. Until then, try not to die.

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_39.speaker: Wyll
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_39.text: From what I've seen, your talents extend well beyond magic. Trust me - you'll be fine.

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_28.speaker: Wyll
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_28.text: Then I'll have your back. Isn't that what friends do?

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_21.speaker: Wyll
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_21.text: Then I'll have your back. When my allies are in danger, I'm not in the habit of turning away.

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_20.speaker: Player
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_20.text: True. My powers will return if they're meant to - like a pet cat. Or maybe a feral one.

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_52.speaker: Wyll
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_52.text: In that case, I've got just one thing to say - 'Meow'.

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_53.speaker: Player
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_53.text: No, you don't get it - this is really bad.

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_101.speaker: Wyll
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_101.text: No worse than having mind flayers bury a tadpole your brain, or crashing to the ground on the banks of the Chionthar.

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_73.speaker: Wyll
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_73.text: We'll work it out. We always do.

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_9.speaker: Player
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_9.text: You're right. We've survived worse problems than this.

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_87.speaker: Wyll
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_87.text: Mind flayers buried tadpoles in our brains, and then we crashed to the ground on the banks of the Chionthar.

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_37.speaker: Wyll
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_37.text: From this angle, there's nothing you can't endure.

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_18.speaker: Gale
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_18.text: It is the same for me. We're sitting ducks among sussur flowers, you and I.

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_67.speaker: Player
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_67.text: Then let's watch each other's backs.

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_68.speaker: Gale
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_68.text: Our backs are very much prone to stabbing in this environment. So by all means - let's.

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_66.speaker: Player
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_66.text: I can swing a sword too if I must.

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_14.speaker: Gale
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_14.text: And I'll be delighted to see you try - from a safe distance.

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_41.speaker: Player
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_41.text: Speak for yourself. I hate sitting, and I never quack in public.

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_80.speaker: Lae'zel
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_80.text: Then gather your wits - these amateur dramatics wear thin.

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_102.speaker: Shadowheart
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_102.text: That's usually my line. Suddenly seems unconvincing, hearing it from someone else.

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_69.speaker: Karlach
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_69.text: And I'm the queen of Baldur's Gate. But all right - let's move.

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_11.speaker: Astarion
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_11.text: 'Nothing' is doing a number on you, then, but suit yourself.

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_49.speaker: Wyll
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_49.text: That 'nothing' sure looks like something to me. If you need to rest, just say the word.

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_64.speaker: Gale
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_64.text: Need I remind you you're addressing a wizard? I know what's going on - it's happening to me as well.

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_72.speaker: Lae'zel
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_72.text: Your good health is our business - our alliance depends on it. I suggest you remember that.

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_5.speaker: Shadowheart
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_5.text: Your business is mine, and vice versa. We're relying on each other, remember?

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_61.speaker: Karlach
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_61.text: 'Mind your own damn business, I'm busy inserting my head into my arse.'

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_82.speaker: Astarion
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_82.text: Oh, pardon. I'll leave you to drop dead in your own time, then.
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_82.context: NodeContext: Responding to "mind your own damn business"

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_1.speaker: Wyll
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_1.text: An owlbear's pissed in your porridge, from the sounds of it. Just remember: I'm not your enemy here.

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_77.speaker: Gale
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_77.text: Fear is a normal response when one feels one's magic slipping away. No need to lash out.

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_98.speaker: Lae'zel
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_98.text: Something's wrong - your manner betrays you. What curse has this plant wrought?

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_85.speaker: Shadowheart
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_85.text: What's the matter? I could swear this plant's got you flush.

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_74.speaker: Karlach
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_74.text: Hey - what's wrong? You look spooked.

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_106.speaker: Astarion
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_106.text: You look drained, and I know it wasn't me. Is the plant bothering you?

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_51.speaker: Wyll
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_51.text: What's wrong - is the plant getting to you? You look sicker than a drunk derro.

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_94.speaker: Gale
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_94.text: That flower isn't agreeing with you, is it? Doesn't sit well with me either.

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_81.speaker: Narrator
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_81.text: *For the first time in memory, you're without magic. You feel...*
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_81.context: InternalNodeContext: No one to include, so speaker 1 is the only speaker in this dialog.

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_55.speaker: Player
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_55.text: Furious. How dare a wretched flower take what is yours?

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_104.speaker: Narrator
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_104.text: *Your magic is gone, replaced by fury. You and your powers are one - this will be temporary.*

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_105.speaker: Player
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_105.text: At ease. Without magic, things feel so peaceful.

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_91.speaker: Narrator
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_91.text: *A quiet contentment settles in your chest. Perhaps a life without power would not be so terrible.*

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_38.speaker: Player
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_38.text: Indifferent. If your power is truly yours it will return to you.

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_56.speaker: Narrator
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_56.text: *With or without your powers you're at ease. Magic cannot be tamed - not even by you.*

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_36.speaker: Player
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_36.text: Disturbed. No chaos? No thank you.

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_71.speaker: Narrator
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_71.text: *The boredom is like an itch you cannot scratch. The sooner you deal with this flower, the better.*

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_32.speaker: Player
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_32.text: Like you've lost a friend. Without your ancestor, it's too quiet.

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_50.speaker: Narrator
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_50.text: *You have been alone before, but this isolation is alien. The sooner you get away from this flower, the better.*

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_63.speaker: Player
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_63.text: Fight it. You need your magic. You need it!

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_4.speaker: Player
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_4.text: Call on your ancestor. You will not submit!

IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_79.speaker: Narrator
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_79.text: *Your magic erupts, violent and powerful, but is snuffed out by the sussur flower - vanishing like embers in the wind.*
IVB_Aura_Sorcerer_79.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player clenches fingers, eyes closed in furious concentration, but to no avail. Eyes open wide in surprise - their magic is gone
